author: Special Correspondent
text:
Senior bureaucrat P.K. Mohanty on Monday took charge as the Chief Secretary of Kerala.

The 1980 batch IPS officer had earlier served as additional chief secretary, Parliamentary Affairs Department. During his tenure, he has handled Forests, Fisheries, Animal Husbandry, Civil Supplies, Finance and Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe Departments.

He was the director of the Information and Public Relations Department from 1998 to 1999. Born in New Delhi on May 1, 1998, Mr. Mohanty is a postgraduate in English Literature and a postgraduate diploma holder in management.

Chief Minister Oommen Chandy will attend a send-off to retired Chief Secretary Jiji Thomson at the Durbar Hall at 10.15 a.m. on Tuesday.
title: Mohanty takes charge as Chief Secretary
